title: Peer Review and Revising Interpretations
objective: Apply feedback and revise interpretive conclusions when warranted

required_passages.text: Observe the wisdom principle that initial claims require testing through further examination.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson seventeen. Learn to accept critique and revise interpretive claims.
Read Proverbs 18:17 and apply its principle to peer feedback and revising interpretations.
Scholarly dialogue refines interpretation. Peer review exposes blind spots and improves evidential support.
When critique identifies weak evidence, modify your claim, document changes, and explain why the revision is superior.
Key virtue: scholarly humilityâ€”interpretations can improve with community testing.
What should you do when a reviewer points out weak evidence?
This completes lesson seventeen. Final lesson summarizes method and next steps for practice.

vocabulary.definition: Critical evaluation of scholarly work by qualified peers to improve quality and validity

study_notes: Keep revision history and reasons to demonstrate intellectual integrity.
